text: The key is not the will to win... it is the will to prepare to win. Plan your focus; focus on your plan.
author: Bobby Knight (adapted)

text: Design your environment to support focus. A dedicated space for deep work is a warrior's dojo.
author: Cal Newport (adapted)

text: Schedule your priorities, don't just prioritize your schedule. Your focus time is sacred.
author: Quetzal Dragon

text: The successful warrior is the average person, with laser-like focus.
author: Quetzal Dragon

text: Unleash your inner dragon: concentrate and conquer the task at hand.
author: Quetzal Dragon

text: Every focused session forges a stronger you. Each Pomodoro is a rep for your mind.
author: Quetzal Dragon

text: It is important to draw wisdom from many different places. If you take it from only one place, it becomes rigid and stale.
author: Uncle Iroh

text: Protection and power are overrated. I think you are very wise to choose happiness and love.
author: Uncle Iroh

text: Sometimes the best way to solve your own problems is to help someone else.
author: Uncle Iroh

text: Your first step to a limitless mind is mastering your mindset. Believe in your ability to learn and grow.
author: Inspired by Jim Kwik

text: Chunk your learning. Break down complex information into small, manageable pieces, like a dragon hoarding treasure one gem at a time.
author: Inspired by Learning How to Learn

text: Alternate between focused (Pomodoro) and diffuse thinking (break) to unlock creative solutions.
author: Inspired by Learning How to Learn

text: Small habits, consistently applied, lead to atomic results. Each focused session builds momentum.
author: Inspired by Atomic Habits

text: Identify the cue, routine, and reward. Understanding your habit loops is the first step to mastering them.
author: Inspired by The Power of Habit

text: A true Dragon Warrior finds strength not in avoiding distraction, but in returning to focus, again and again.
author: Quetzal Dragon

text: Mindfulness is the art of taming the chattering monkeys in your head. Focus on one breath, one task.
author: Inspired by Buddhist Principles

text: The 'evil' of procrastination is defeated by the 'good' of starting, even for just one Pomodoro.
author: Inspired by Anthropology/Philosophy

text: Like a game, track your 'XP' (Experience Points) through completed sessions and 'level up' your focus skills.
author: Inspired by Gaming

text: Pride is not the opposite of shame, but its source. True humility is the only antidote to shame.
author: Uncle Iroh

text: What you think, you become. What you feel, you attract. What you imagine, you create. Focus your thoughts.
author: Inspired by Buddhist Principles

text: A designated study area is your training ground. Keep it sacred, keep it focused.
author: Quetzal Dragon

text: Box breathing: Inhale for 4, hold for 4, exhale for 4, hold for 4. Center your chi before battle (with your task!).
author: Quetzal Dragon
